data.name: SQL: A simple SUM query
data.description:
```
PLEASE DO NOT ATTEMPT! CURRENTLY BROKEN AS LANGUAGE SQL CAN NOT BE ASSIGNED TO THE KATA DUE TO SOME BUG.
```

For this challenge you need to create a simple SUM query that will sum all the values from column "stuff" into two new columns called "positive", and "negative". 

The column "positive" should be the sum of all positive numbers from column "stuff", and the column "negative" should be the sum of all negative values from column "stuff".

Given an initial table with the following values:

```
mysql> SELECT * FROM numbers;
+-------+
| stuff |
+-------+
|     3 |
|    -2 |
|    -6 |
|     1 |
|    -1 |
|     4 |
+-------+

```

The query should return the following:

```
+----------+----------+
| positive | negative |
+----------+----------+
|        8 |       -9 |
+----------+----------+


```
